meanings.definition: The process of making something less casual or informal.
meanings.sent1: The decasualization of the dress code brought a more professional atmosphere to the office.
meanings.sent2: The decasualization of the party dress code surprised many guests.
meanings.sent3: The decasualization of the beach attire made everyone look overdressed.
meanings.sent4: Her decasualization of the conversation turned a friendly chat into a serious discussion.
meanings.sent5: The decasualization of the event made it feel like a formal affair.

meanings.definition: The act of converting temporary or casual workers into permanent employees.
meanings.sent1: The decasualization of the workforce led to more job security for many employees.
meanings.sent2: The company's decasualization policy aimed to provide stability to its workers.
meanings.sent3: The decasualization of the team made the interns feel like valued members.
meanings.sent4: His decasualization of the staffing structure transformed the office dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The decasualization of the staff improved employee morale and loyalty.
